summary.text:
Given the itemId, will collapse the corresponding accordion-item.

If the itemId is not valid, nothing will happen.
It will collapse all the accordion-items in the accordion.

Given the itemId, will expand the corresponding accordion-item.

If the itemId is not valid, nothing will happen.

It will expand all the items in the accordion.

If
`closeOthers`
is
`true`
it will expand only the last accordion-item.
Creates a new accordionItem.

Given the itemId, will toggle the corresponding accordion-item.

If the itemId is not valid, nothing will happen.
Directive to put on the accordion DOM element
Action to be called when the user clicks on the accordion-item button. If the accordion-item is disabled nothing will happen.
It will collapse the accordion-item.
It will expand the accordion-item.
Method to be called after the initialization to allow animations.
It will toggle the accordion-item.
Directive to apply aria attributes to the expanded body panel
Directive to be put on the accordion-item body container. It will handle the animation.
Directive to put on the accordion-item body.
Directive to put on the button element that will control the collapsing of the accordion-item.
Directive to put on the accordion-item header that will contain the button element.
Directive to be put on the accordion-item. It will handle adding the accordion-item to the accordion.
Directive to use in special cases, if the accordion header does not use a button element to control the collapsing.
Directive to apply the itemTransition
If
`true`
, accordion-item will be animated.
CSS classes to add on the accordion-item body DOM element.

CSS classes to add on the accordion-item body container DOM element.
The accordion-item body container is the DOM element on what the itemTransition is applied.
CSS classes to add on the accordion-item collapse DOM element.

Content present in the accordion body.

It is a prop of the accordion-item.
CSS classes to be applied on the widget main container
If
`true`
, the accordion-item body container will be removed from the DOM when the accordion-item is collapsed. It will be just hidden otherwise.
If
`true`

, the accordion-item will be disabled.
It will not react to user's clicks, but still will be possible to toggle programmatically.

Content present in the accordion button inside the accordion header.

It is a prop of the accordion-item.
CSS classes to add on the accordion-item header DOM element.
The html tag to use for the accordion-item-header.
The id of the accordion-item. It can be used for controlling the accordion-item via the accordion api.
An event fired when an item is hidden.
An event fired when an item is shown.
An event fired when the
`visible`

value changes.

Event payload is the new value of visible.

Structure of the accordion-item. The default item structure is: accordion-item
contains accordion header and accordion-item body container; the accordion header contains the accordion button
(that contains
`header`
), while the accordion-item body container contains the accordion body (that contains
`children`
The transition to use for the accordion-item body-container when the accordion-item is toggled.
If
`true`
, the accordion-item will be visible (expanded). Otherwise, it will be hidden (collapsed).
CSS classes to add on the accordion-item body DOM element.

CSS classes to add on the accordion-item body container DOM element.
The accordion-item body container is the DOM element on what the itemTransition is applied.

Content present in the accordion body.

It is a prop of the accordion-item.
CSS classes to be applied on the widget main container
If
`true`

, the accordion-item will be disabled.
It will not react to user's clicks, but still will be possible to toggle programmatically.

It is a prop of the accordion-item.

the content of the accordion-item collapse should be in DOM. Its value depends on the
value of the
`visible`
and

Triggers alert closing programmatically (same as clicking on the close button ()).
Triggers the alert to be displayed for the user.
the transition directive, piloting what is the visual effect of going from hidden to visible
If
`true`

, alert closing will be animated.

Animation is triggered  when clicked on the close button (),
via the
`.close()`
function or the visible prop is changed
If
`true`

`.open()`

function is called
or the visible prop is changed

`true`

, alert can be dismissed by the user.
The close button () will be displayed and you can be notified of the event with the (close) output.
Callback called when the alert is hidden.
Callback called when the alert is shown.
Callback called when the alert visibility changed.
Global template for the alert component

The transition function will be executed when the alert is displayed or hidden.

Depending on the value of
`animatedOnInit`
, the animation can be optionally skipped during the showing process.

the alert is visible to the user

Actions of the modal widget.
Action to be called when the user clicks on the close button. It closes the modal with the
modalCloseButtonClick
result.
mouse event

Action to be called when the user clicks on the modal DOM element (which is supposed to have the size of the full viewport).
If the click is not done on a descendant of the modal DOM element, it is considered to be done outside the modal
and, depending on the value of the
closeOnOutsideClick

prop, the modal is or isn't closed
(with the
modalOutsideClick
result).
mouse event
Method to change some modal properties.
Modify the parameter values, and recalculate the stores accordingly
Closes the modal with the given result.
result of the modal, as passed in the
result
property of the event passed to the
onBeforeClose
event handler (and possibly changed by it) and resolved by the promise returned by the
ModalApi.open|open
method.

Opens the modal and returns a promise that is resolved when the modal is closed.
The resolved value is the result passed to the
ModalApi.close|close
method and possibly changed by the
onBeforeClose
event handler
Type of the parameter of
onBeforeClose

Whether to cancel the close of the modal.
It can be changed from the
onBeforeClose
event handler.
Result of the modal, which is the value passed to the
ModalApi.close|close

method
and later resolved by the promise returned by the
ModalApi.open|open

method.
If needed, it can be changed from the
onBeforeClose
event handler.
Directives of the modal widget.

Portal directive to put on the backdrop DOM element.
Directive that adds all the necessary attributes to the close button

Directive to put on the modal DOM element.
Portal directive to put on the modal DOM element.
Whether the modal and its backdrop (if present) should be animated when shown or hidden.

The transition to use for the backdrop behind the modal (if present).
Body of the modal.
CSS classes to be applied on the widget main container
Whether to display the close button.
Whether the modal should be closed when clicking on the viewport outside the modal.

Which element should contain the modal and backdrop DOM elements.
If it is not null, the modal and backdrop DOM elements are moved to the specified container.
Otherwise, they stay where the widget is located.
Data to use in content slots
Footer of the modal.
Option to create a fullscreen modal, according to the bootstrap documentation.
Header of the modal. The default header includes
title

ModalApi.close|close
method was called).
event giving access to the argument given to the
ModalApi.close|close

method and allowing
to cancel the close process.

new value of the visible propery

The number of items in your paginated collection.

Note, that this is not the number of pages. Page numbers are calculated dynamically based on
`collectionSize`
and
`pageSize`

.

Ex. if you have 100 items in your collection and displaying 20 items per page, you'll end up with 5 pages.

Whatever the collectionSize the page number is of minimum 1.

readme.text:
# @agnos-ui/core-bootstrap

[![npm](https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@agnos-ui/core-bootstrap)](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@agnos-ui/core-bootstrap)

This package is made of styles and widget extensions necessary to use AgnosUI with Bootstrap.
It contains both CSS and SCSS files allowing same customizability as Bootstrap.

It is a dependency of
